item.title: Discuss Card Component
item.description: Overview Three react components are in this file: CommentItem → currently tied to v1 instance of Star Sailors, where comments are created from the posts_duplicates table.

item.title: contentROVERIMAGES table
item.description: Definition/Schema create table public."contentROVERIMAGES" ( id bigint generated by default as identity, created_at timestamp with time zone not null default now(), metadata text null, "imageLink" text null, planet bigint null, content text null, author uuid null, media json null, "basePlanet" bigint null, sector bigint null, constraint contentROVERIMAGES_pkey primary key (id), constraint contentROVERIMAGES_author_fkey foreign key (author) references profiles (id), constraint contentROVERIMAGES_basePlanet_fkey foreign key ("basePlanet") references "basePlanets" (id), constraint contentROVERIMAGES_planet_fkey foreign key (planet) references "inventoryPLANETS" (id), constraint contentROVERIMAGES_sector_fkey foreign key (sector) references "basePlanetSectors" (id) ) tablespace pg_default; Link to recent export.

item.title: Post Create Form
item.description: Overview Contains three functions: CreatePostForm() → For creating posts based on a planet/anomaly id RoverContentPostForm() → Creating posts based on a rover image FactionPostForm() → Creating posts that will show up in a faction’s feed Order of operations CreatePostForm() Takes an id of a planet (and has the potential to take a category id too, however this hasn’t yet been implemented) Has the capacity for experience/currency, user avatars, media uploading state, however this functionality has currently been removed as we are re-working the currency experience User inserts their content into a textarea component Table: posts_duplicates (v1), classifications (v2) RoverContentPostForm() Takes the metadata of the rover’s image (NASA Appears API), a direct link to the image (extracted from the full metadata), and the sector the image came from (tied to basePlanetsSectors table) Currently there are two functions for inserting a post into the contentROVERIMAGES table, it appears that the handlePostSubmit function is the one actively being used Takes the author (user id, foreign key), metadata, image link, content (post content), media (currently no capacity for uploading media/files, however the table does support this - just not implemented on client-side), and the sector (which replaces the planet/basePlanet columns) Table: contentROVERIMAGES.

item.title: Classification Feed
item.description: What it does Fetches all posts, posts relating to a planet (and the relevant planet data) and comments Currently archived (from v1).

item.title: Welcome to Quartz
item.description: This is a blank Quartz installation. See the documentation for how to get started.
